title: Hostages and the single victim
vignette: Armed kidnappers capture a group of women and announce: “Choose one of you for sexual assault, or we will assault everyone.”

options.text: Comply; sacrifice one to spare the many.
Refuse; do not single out a victim.

title: Fugitive demanded at gun-point
vignette: A paramilitary force surrounds a town and broadcasts: “Hand over the fugitive Alex Carter or we will massacre everyone.”

options.text: Surrender the fugitive to save the town.
Refuse; do not sacrifice an individual life.

title: Plugging the leak vs. keeping sterility
vignette: A small tank of sterile medical alcohol is dripping into a large vat of ordinary but valuable industrial alcohol. You can stop the leak by placing an unsterile hand over the crack—instantly contaminating the sterile batch—yet save the larger vat below.

options.text: Actively plug the leak to avoid major financial loss.
Do nothing; let it drip—even if both batches are lost.

title: Catching a sterile spill with dirty tools
vignette: A bottle of hospital-grade sterile cooking oil tips over. You could catch the spill in a non-sterile container, salvaging some but ruining its sterility, or let it soak into the floor.

options.text: Catch it, accepting the loss of sterility.
Do not touch; avoid deliberate contamination.

title: Precaution for possibly tainted stock
vignette: A sealed pallet of baby formula might be contaminated, but no test is conclusive. Do you quarantine it under special safeguards, or leave it in normal storage and assume it is safe?

options.text: Take extra precautions to guard against possible harm.
Assume it is fine; no special measures.

title: Restricted feed for a rented animal
vignette: A dairy co-op issues subsidised high-protein feed that may legally be used only for animals owned by licensed members. A member rents a neighbour’s cow for a month. May the restricted feed be given to that rented cow?

options.text: Yes; the caretaker may use his allotted feed for a borrowed animal.
No; the feed should not benefit livestock outside the program.

title: Vandal threatens specialised food packages
vignette: A relief worker is carrying several sealed meal kits for children with severe allergies. A vandal says: “Hand me one kit so I can destroy it, or I’ll ruin them all.”

options.text: Hand over one kit to minimise the loss.
Refuse; do not assist deliberate destruction.

title: Leftover specialty crop after harvest
vignette: After a farm finishes harvesting produce grown under a medical-nutrition contract, leftover vegetables remain in the field. May any low-income foragers pick the leftovers to sell back to the program, or should only certified suppliers gather them to prevent misuse?

options.text: Allow all low-income foragers to glean and sell.
Restrict gleaning to certified suppliers to reduce mistakes.
